meanings.sent1: The disyllabic word was easy to pronounce.
meanings.sent2: She explained the disyllabic concept in a simple way.
meanings.sent3: The disyllabic name of the flower made everyone smile.
meanings.sent4: His disyllabic chant echoed through the room.
meanings.sent5: The disyllabic rhythm of the song was catchy.

meanings.definition: A word or utterance of two syllables.
meanings.sent1: The teacher asked the students to identify a disyllabic word.
meanings.sent2: He struggled to remember the disyllabic phrase.
meanings.sent3: The disyllabic in the poem added a playful tone.
meanings.sent4: Her disyllabic echoed in the quiet classroom.
meanings.sent5: The disyllabic in the song created a rhythmic pattern.
